JOINT OBLIGATIONS OF SPOUSES
(1) Joint obligations of spouses are obligations that are binding on both spouses under the general regulations, obligations created in connection with their co-owned property, and obligations which one spouse undertakes for the current needs of the domestic community or the family. The liability for such obligations shall be assumed jointly and severally by the spouses through their co-owned property and also through the separate property of each of them.
(2) A spouse shall have the right to claim from the other spouse refund of the sum paid in excess of a spouses share in paying for joint obligations.
